intro: Trembleya triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered trembleya, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
